body: Can I try to do this issue? First time contributing to the project.

To handle the "StreamlitDuplicateElementId" exception, I was considering a solution where, if a widget is inside a sidebar root container and no key is provided, I modify the key by adding a custom key (sidebar, element_type, label) to avoid duplication. Would this be a valid approach, or is the preferred solution to identify duplicate keys without actually changing them before raising an exception?

Hey @joaooliveira-11, I think that seems like a plausible first approach. I imagine we would need to test out the changes and different formats (For example. Will this work with `with st.sidebar` or another `with st.container()`). I sense this may not be as straightforward, but we won't know until we try.
can i try for this issue

> can i try for this issue

Im already working on it for my master's degree course project. Please pick another issue.

issue.title: Fixed StreamlitDuplicateElementId when same widget is both in the main and sidebar area

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit â€” A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes
- Added a new optional parameter `active_dg_root_container` to the `compute_and_register_element_id` function.
- This is used to get the root container of the `DeltaGenerator` that's currently 'active'.
- This parameter is present when widgets and hybrid-widgets call this function.
- This parameter is used to verify if the widget is inside the sidebar area.
- If the widget is inside the sidebar area and the user key is not provided, a new key is created with an hardcoded string `sidebar`, the parameter `element_type` and if present, the parameter `label`.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

fixes #10598

## Testing Plan

âœ… Added Unit Tests (Python):

- To test this new enhancement, every widget and hybrid-widget was tested to be both inside a container in the main and sidebar area  with the use of `with` blocks.




---

issue.title: Fix: StreamlitDuplicateElementId when same widget is both in the main and sidebar area

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit â€” A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

- Added a new optional parameter `dg` to the `compute_and_register_element_id()` function.
- This is used to get the `DeltaGenerator` of each element.
- This parameter is present when widgets and hybrid-widgets call this function.
- This parameter is used to retrieve the current `active_dg` and its `root_container` to verify if the widget is inside the sidebar area.
- If the widget is inside the sidebar area and the user key is not provided, `active_dg_root_container` is added to the `kwargs_to_use`.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

fixes #10598

## Testing Plan

âœ… Added Unit Tests (Python):

- To test this new enhancement, every widget and hybrid-widget was tested to be both inside a container in the main and sidebar area  with the use of `with` blocks.

## Suggestions

- Is there a way to get the DeltaGenerator that's currently 'active' inside the `compute_and_register_element_id()` without passing an extra parameter? Seems like the stack is only updated with the use of `with` blocks.
- Custom components should also implement this solution?
- Passing one extra argument for this function is a valid approach? 
- If it does not make sense to have the parameter as optional some tests will need to be fixed, namely, custom components or other tests that use this function.

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.
